00035 class U_EXPORT UHttpClient_Base : virtual public UClient_Base {
00036 public:
00037 
00038         static UString* str_www_authenticate;
00039         static UString* str_proxy_authenticate;
00040         static UString* str_proxy_authorization;
00041 
00042         static void str_allocate();
00043 
00044         void reset();
00045         void setHostForbidden(const UString& host) { forbidden = host; }
00046 
00047         // Returns a modifiable sequence of MIME-type headers that will be used to form a request to the HTTP server
00048 
00049         UMimeHeader* getRequestHeader() { return requestHeader; }
00050 
00059         void setHeader(const UString& name, const UString& value) { requestHeader->setHeader(name, value); }
00060 
00061         void setHeaderHostPort(const UString& h)  { setHeader(*USocket::str_host, h); }
00062         void setHeaderUserAgent(const UString& u) { setHeader(*USocket::str_user_agent, u); }
00063 
00064         void removeHeader(const UString& name) { requestHeader->removeHeader(name); }
00065 
00066         // Returns the MIME header that were received in response from the HTTP server
00067 
00068         UMimeHeader* getResponseHeader() { return responseHeader; }
00069 
00077         bool getFollowRedirects() const        { return bFollowRedirects; }
00078         void setFollowRedirects(bool bFollow)  { bFollowRedirects = bFollow; }
00079 
00080         // In response to a HTTP_UNAUTHORISED response from the HTTP server,
00081         // obtain a userid and password for the scheme/realm returned from the HTTP server
00082 
00083         void setRequestPasswordAuthentication(const UString& _user, const UString& _password) { user = _user; password = _password; }
00084 
00094         bool connectServer(Url& location)
00095                 {
00096                 U_TRACE(0, "UHttpClient_Base::connectServer(%p)", &location)
00097 
00098                 if (UClient_Base::setUrl(location.get()) && UClient_Base::isConnected()) UClient_Base::socket->close(); // change server and/or port to connect...
00099 
00100                 return UClient_Base::connect();
00101                 }
00102 
00103         //=============================================================================
00104         // Send the http request to the remote host.
00105         //
00106         // The request is made up of a request line followed by request header fields. Ex:
00107         //
00108         // GET filename HTTP/1.1
00109         // Host: hostname[:port]
00110         // Connection: close
00111         //
00112         // The response from the server will contain a number of header
00113         // fields followed by the requested data.
00114         //
00115         // Note: HTTP Redirection
00116         // ----------------------
00117         // By default we will follow HTTP redirects. These are communicated
00118         // to us by a 3xx HTTP response code and the presence of a "Location" header
00119         // field. A 3xx response code without a Location header is an error.
00120         // Redirection may be an iterative process, so it continues until
00121         // we receive a 200 OK response or the maximum number of redirects is exceeded.
00122         //
00123         // We do not process Location headers when accompanying a 200 OK response.
00124         //=============================================================================
00125 
00126         bool sendRequest(UString& data);
00127         bool upload(Url& location, UFile& file);
00128         bool sendPost(Url& location, const UString& pbody, const char* content_type = "application/x-www-form-urlencoded");
00129 
00130         UString getContent() const   { return body; }
00131         int     responseCode() const { return UHTTP::http_info.nResponseCode; }
00132 
00133         // DEBUG
00134 
00135 #ifdef DEBUG
00136         const char* dump(bool reset) const;
00137 #endif
00138 
00139 protected:
00140         UMimeHeader* requestHeader;
00141         UMimeHeader* responseHeader;
00142         UString body, forbidden, user, password, method, uri;
00143         bool bFollowRedirects;
00144 
00145          UHttpClient_Base(UFileConfig* cfg);
00146         ~UHttpClient_Base();
00147 
00148         void composeRequest(UString& data, uint32_t& startHeader);
00149 
00150         // In response to a HTTP_UNAUTHORISED response from the HTTP server, this function will attempt
00151         // to generate an Authentication header to satisfy the server.
00152 
00153         bool createAuthorizationHeader();
00154         int  checkResponse(int& redirectCount);
00155 
00156 private:
00157         UHttpClient_Base(const UHttpClient_Base&) : UClient_Base(0) {}
00158         UHttpClient_Base& operator=(const UHttpClient_Base&)                    { return *this; }
00159 };
00160 
00161 template <class Socket> class U_EXPORT UHttpClient : public UHttpClient_Base,  public UClient<Socket> {
00162 public:
00163 
00164         // COSTRUTTORI
00165 
00166         UHttpClient(UFileConfig* cfg) : UClient_Base(cfg), UHttpClient_Base(cfg), UClient<Socket>(cfg)
00167                 {
00168                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, UHttpClient, "%p", cfg)
00169                 }
00170 
00171         ~UHttpClient()
00172                 {
00173                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, UHttpClient)
00174                 }
00175 
00176         // DEBUG
00177 
00178 #ifdef DEBUG
00179         const char* dump(bool reset) const { return UHttpClient_Base::dump(reset); }
00180 #endif
00181 
00182 private:
00183         UHttpClient(const UHttpClient&) : UClient_Base(0), UHttpClient_Base(0), UClient<Socket>(0) {}
00184         UHttpClient& operator=(const UHttpClient&)                                                                                                                               { return *this; }
00185 };
